author: ajsutton
content: This doesn’t appear to support gzip when requesting the state as SSZ (it does when requesting json)

author: jgm
content: So it didn't.  Should behave now.

author: ajsutton
content:
I have learnt today that getting servers to gzip application/octet-stream content is surprisingly difficult. 
But there’s a PR up for checkpointz to support it now and it turned out teku didn’t support it for requesting or serving so there’s a pr for that too.

author: jgm
content: gzip does seem like a relatively easy win to enable across the board, especially now that we're throwing around states and large validator lists.

author: sky.cactus
content: Really?  I would have expected gzipping to work out of the box in most web servers.

author: ajsutton
content: Gzip for text content is simple but most servers disable compression for octet-stream assuming that it won’t be easily compressible. This turns out to be wrong for SSZ.
